subject: Re: [PATCH v3 19/25] fuse: add io-uring kernel-managed buffer ring

reviews.author: Joanne Koong (author)
reviews.summary: The reviewer Joanne Koong clarified how kernel-managed buffer rings work in io-uring, specifically addressing concerns about buffer availability and reuse.

reviews.author: Gabriel Bertazi
reviews.summary: Reviewer Gabriel Bertazi pointed out potential issues in the patch series, specifically suggesting improvements to code organization and behavior for kernel-managed buffer rings.

reviews.author: Caleb Mateos
reviews.summary: Caleb Mateos reviewed several patches in the series and provided feedback on specific technical concerns.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: Reviewer Bernd Schubert raised concerns about the handling of failed copies in the kernel-managed buffer ring, suggesting that they should not block and proposing potential solutions such as a separate queue or wake-up task retry.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: The reviewer raised a concern that the kernel-managed buffer ring may leave a queue entry in FRRS_AVAILABLE if an operation fails, potentially causing issues if there are no other entries in flight.
